text: a couple of years ago I decided to test
all over different winter squashes and
pumpkins to see which one would make the
best pumpkin pie
I tested nine different varieties and
you know what the best pumpkin for
pumpkin pie is butternut squash I
encourage you very strongly to make your
own pie dough because it's just better
if you want to learn how to flute I will
show you you just take these two fingers
and a little finger fold it under as you
go this guy pushes the dough and this
one pinches that's it you do have to
chill it because if you just put this in
the oven right now all of this crimping
will just kind of go this is called
docking the crust this keeps air bubbles
from forming piece of foil and then
these nice pie weights but anything will
work you just want to keep this flat
first I'm gonna bake it with the foil
and the weights on and I'm going to take
the foil and the weights off and I'm
going to expose it to the heat so that
it turns golden now your fake pumpkin
your butternut squash I love a butternut
squash it's so compact so dense so easy
to work with
you want to steady it these things are
slippery I have lost more than one
across the room do you know the trick of
how to cut a pumpkin or a winter squash
if it's so thick that you can't get your
knife through it this is cool
you take the whole squash you put it in
the microwave throw it in there peel and
all in the microwave and then it'll
start to cook and start to soften and so
you'll be able to get your knife into it
good one I'm just gonna spread these out
on a tray
you want to give them a little bit of
room in between just so that the edges
can get brown and I'm just going to use
a little bit of olive oil but melted
butter works really well if you wanted
to you could also toss this with some
sugar and I'm just gonna bake this until
everything is a little bit browned and
the squash need to be very tender
because I'm gonna puree it I need 1 and
3/4 cup which is the amount in one can
of canned pumpkin this is heavy cream
the original recipe on the back of the
can called for evaporated milk which was
a wartime substitution for heavy cream
but we actually have plenty of heavy
cream available so you might as well use
that it tastes better it's fresher I
like dark brown sugar in my pumpkin pie
you can also use light brown sugar you
could use white sugar you could use
maple sugar if you want to be fancy this
is purely optional
I love brandy with pumpkin pie I just
think that it heightens the pumpkin
flavor or the butternut squash flavor
cinnamon ginger is essential in pumpkin
pie I think clove sharpens all the other
spices and then nutmeg one of these is
about a teaspoon you can see that it
kind of rises above the pie crust that's
fine because as a big it kind of falls
in and then you bake it until it just
holds together when you wiggle it you
should be able to see a little wiggle
but not too much then you know it's done
the only sad thing about a pumpkin or
butternut squash pie is they usually
make it for Thanksgiving and then you
bake it in the morning and then it's
hours before you get to cut into it and
eat it and honestly waiting is the
hardest thing
oh oh
